experience: You and Wayne both know John Furrier, Jeff Pulver, and 32 others
‚Ä™Video: Watch & learn more about New America CA 2017  CA Fellows  üëâüèæ  New America ‚Ä¨
Please watch: Why we focus on creating an inclusive tech ecosystem.
Where are the ALL LIVES folks now?!
How can we continue to do better?
Facebook and Tech companies in SF should feel some sort of way when your workforce even the NON TECH roles consist of less than 2-4% Black or Brown! These are facts not my opinions but FACTS!
While some are talking gender pay equity - I‚Äôm still confused on the disproportion of job opportunities!!!!
So grateful to have witnessed the talk from Black Lives Matter Activist - DeRay McKesson and Tech Inclusion Wayne Sutton
When Wayne said ‚ÄúThere are only 48,000 Black people in San Francisco and only 2,000 are not on government assistance‚Äù
Check this NY Times piece to learn more: https://nyti.ms/2ahSajP
This gave me chills and made me think of my own privilege daily.
What am I doing to help others?!
What can I do more outside of my immediate circles?!

Change Catalyst empowers diverse, inclusive and sustainable tech innovation - through Tech Inclusion and Startup Ecosystem programs.Our Tech Inclusion programs explore and develop innovative solutions to tech diversity and inclusion. We partner with the tech community to solve diversity and inclusion together through conferences, career fairs, strategic consulting and training. Our work spans the full tech ecosystem, including: Education, Workplace, Entrepreneurship and Policy.Our Startup Ecosystem programs help underrepresented entrepreneurs and investors to start, scale and fund worldchanging businesses. We provide education, mentoring and deal flow opportunities for investors looking to invest in underrepresented entrepreneurs. We support underrepresented entrepreneurs through education, mentorship, networking and funding opportunities.Change Catalyst is a Certified B Corp, winning the "Best for the World"‚Äã award for community impact in 2014 and "Best in the World"‚Äã overall in 2015.

Tech Inclusion explores and develops innovative solutions to tech diversity and inclusion. We partner with the tech community to solve diversity and inclusion together through conferences, career fairs, strategic consulting and training. Our work spans the full tech ecosystem, including: Education, Workplace, Entrepreneurship and Policy.Join us at a Tech Inclusion event this year! Tech Inclusion Conferences, Career Fairs & Startup Showcases:Seattle, June 14-15New York, July 10-11Atlanta, August 10-11San Francisco, October 24-26Tech Inclusion Forums:Austin, 3/15Chicago, 9/12Detroit, 5/11Durham, 9/21London, 12/14Miami, 12/11Minneapolis, 9/14Nashville, 8/17San Juan, 12/7Sydney, 11/30More here: https://blog.techinclusion.co/join-us-in-driving-jobs-empathy-and-tech-inclusion-across-the-u-s-and-beyond-in-2017-703b000e35ee#.87af1v9n8------2016 Events:- Inclusion 2.0 @ Wisdom Week, 2/18, San Francisco CA- Tech Inclusion Austin @ SXSW, 3/13, Austin TX- Ability in Tech Summit, 5/21, Berkeley CA- Tech Inclusion NYC, 6/29-30, New York NY- Tech Inclusion 2016, 10/26-27, San Francisco CAEnough talk about the problems, let's get together and work on real solutions to diversity and inclusion. Hear best practices, share what works and doesn't work, learn actionable steps you can take in tech to make a difference.Come join the conversation about solutions spanning the entire ecosystem of tech. Let's learn together, and let's change tech together.techinclusion.co(A project of Change Catalyst: changecatalyst.co )

2017 Class of New America CA Fellows. This year's fellows will be working on a wide range of pressing social challenges and innovative projects, including immigration, virtual reality, education, tech inclusiveness, journalism and political participation. These cutting-edge social entrepreneurs inspire decision-makers to make local, state, and national progress in policy and practice.
A network of CIO, CTO or senior-level technology executives at companies across industries
Accelerator Live Pitch Event Advisory Board Member

Recommending judges and companies to participate in the SXSW Accelerator Live Pitch Event. Reviewing companies applying to present in the Accelerator Live Pitch Event in the categories of Augmented & Virtual Reality, Enterprise & Smart Data, Entertainment & Content, Health & Wearable, Hyper-Connected Communities, Payment & FinTech, Security & Privacy, Social & Culture, Sports & Performance Data and Transportation.

recommendations: Tommy Leep
Helping founders build startups
July 9, 2015, Tommy worked with Wayne but at different companies

Wayne is a righteous leader, creator and connector. He supports founders and people in the tech community through his startup expertise and connections. He's a builder who experiments with new projects, learns what sticks and pushes forward. As a connector he is generous with his network and accessible to founders who seek his guidance. We're lucky to have Wayne as part of the glue in Silicon Valley.

Theodore Wilhite
2L Law Student expected graduation 2019
July 21, 2014, Theodore was a client of Wayne‚Äôs

Spoke to over 350 high school scholars exploring college options in the Engineering and Technology at the University of California Berkeley campus. The results were amazing, as he garnered thought provoking questions that range from character and ethics and creative thought processes. I was impressed how his presentation was tailored around our, Envision's mission statement (http://envisionexperience.com), something he did without solicitation. I think our young people were able to identify with his story and journey and the feedback is they were left inspired. We look forward to him speaking to our next session of 350+ scholars next week. Wayne you're awesome! Keep Inspiring!

Sai Arora
Business Operations, Cloud at Magento
July 12, 2014, Sai worked with Wayne but at different companies

I was very glad when our paths crossed with Wayne's. He has been a true mentor for us, giving honest feedback and the right advice whenever needed. His advice opened up a lot of different opportunities for us. Wayne understood our concept immediately and voraciously encouraged our pursuit despite us having limited experience in the space.  Wayne's enthusiasm and support of our project helped build the confidence needed to get out there and excel. Within five weeks, our startup raised seed funding and we truly grew on a personal level.

La Quita Denese Frederick, EdD Candidate
Director of Sport Management at Saint Peter's University
January 19, 2014, Wayne was a client of La Quita Denese‚Äôs

Wayne Sutton is the epitome of a technology guru (his preferred term is geek)! Not only is Wayne a serial entrepreneur and technology journalist, he is an inspiring and knowledgeable thought leader. Whether developing websites and digital strategy, mentoring aspiring STEM students, partnering with industry peers, or speaking to the masses, he brings a contagious enthusiasm to all of his projects, partnerships and presentations. Sincerely, it is my pleasure to collaborate with him on projects big and small, but more importantly, to deliver the highest level and best quality of service to a client I hold in high regard.

July 2, 2013, Serbino was a client of Wayne‚Äôs

Wayne Sutton is an extraordinary man. Everything that he does is fascinating. From co-creating a start-up accelerator, NewMe, to PitchTo Inc., this is the ‚Äòtech-preneur‚Äô that you should follow. Sutton is a trailblazer. He is a part of the one percent of African-Americans to start an Internet business; just think about that; one percent. He‚Äôs making a difference. Even Soledad O‚ÄôBrien knew he was an amazing talent when she featured him in the CNN series Black in America: The New Promised Land ‚Äì Silicon Valley http://vimeo.com/49293655. Dreams do come true sometimes. Sutton is making his own dreams come true and along the way, he‚Äôs helping others. What a phenomenal role model!

summary: Wayne Sutton is a serial entrepreneur and co-founder of Change Catalyst and its Tech Inclusion programs. Change Catalyst is dedicated to exploring innovative solutions to diversity and inclusion in tech through the Tech Inclusion Conference, training, workshops and the Change Catalyst Startup Fellows Program. Sutton‚Äôs experience includes years of establishing partnerships with large brands to early stage startups. As a leading voice in diversity and inclusion in tech, Sutton shares his thoughts on solutions and culture in various media outlets where he has been featured in TechCrunch, USA Today, and the Wall Street Journal. In addition to mentoring and advising early stage startups, Sutton‚Äôs life goal is to educate entrepreneurs who are passionate about using technology to change the world.
name: Wayne Sutton
title: Co-founder of Change Catalyst and its Tech Inclusion programs. Creating an inclusive and diverse tech ecosystem.
